author: Special Correspondent
text:
During the ongoing special drive for purification of electoral rolls, the Election Commission has identified over 3.70 lakh cases which include duplicate entry of voters and names of deceased persons.

“As of today, we have identified the names of 1.90 lakh persons, who have been found to be dead and another 1.80 lakh entries, which are duplicate entries. We will remove them once we complete the exercise, which is expected in the next four days,” Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said.

He also requested the relatives of those persons who are dead to remove their entries through due process. According to the latest figure from the Commission, there are about 5.79 crore voters in the State.

The Election Commission is also organising a special camp in Chennai, Cuddalore, Tiruvallur and Kancheepuram districts on February 29, in which voters, who had lost their Electors Photo Identity Cards (EPICs), can get a new card.

A statement from Mr. Lakhoni said voters can walk into the office of the Electoral Registration Officer and fill form No.001 in these four districts and get new cards.

Members of the South Indian Artistes Association met Mr. Lakhoni and presented a plea to relax norms, which restricted them from staging plays in the days before and on polling day.
title: Over 3.7 lakh duplicate entries, dead voters in rolls
